channel.title: Uruguay – Vamos a Bailar
channel.description: A traveling blog for discovering South America

item.title: Beaches in Uruguay: Punta del Diablo and Cabo Polonio
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Punta del Diablo I did a small break at Punta del Diablo, a small town near the sea. The beaches are beautiful and thanks to the end of the vacation quiet! A nearby park called Santa Tereza is worth the visit. At the North End, there is an impressive fortress. Unfortunately, it was closed the […]

The post Beaches in Uruguay: Punta del Diablo and Cabo Polonio appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Montevideo carnival
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
The carnival in Uruguay The event The carnival in Uruguay is the longest one in the world, lasting in total for 40 days. The 3 main events are the opening on the first day, the parades in the middle and the final performance weekend. However, during all that 40 days, you can enjoy shows in […]

The post Montevideo carnival appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: A journey to Uruguay
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
While spending one month in Buenos Aires, I started to feel oppress by the big city. Thus I was looking for an escape to get nature and peace. I tried two journeys. One to Tigre a classical destination of Porte√±os (the nickname given to inhabitants of Buenos Aires) and a second to another country Uruguay. […]
